content: Who composed the famous classical piece 'Moonlight Sonata', originally named 'Piano Sonata No.14 in C-sharp minor'?

The famous classical piece known as "Moonlight Sonata," originally named "Piano Sonata No. 14 in C-sharp minor," was composed by Ludwig van Beethoven. This sonata is one of his most renowned works and is particularly noted for its first movement, which has a hauntingly beautiful adagio sostenuto that gives the sonata its nickname "Moonlight." The piece was completed in 1801 and dedicated to his pupil and possible romantic interest, Countess Giulietta Guicciardi.
